danish_publication: Justitsråd Fischer i Vestervig kjørte en dag på landevejen og møder der en gammel Nordmand, som gik og tiggede. Han holdt og bød ham at sætte sig op på vognen, for nu var han arresteret som løsgjænger. "Ånej", siger Nordmanden, "lad mig gå, justitsrådens heste kan dog ikke trække mig." — "Jo, det skal der ikke være noget i vejen for, sid bare op." Efter at have gjort et par indvendinger sad han så op ved siden af kusken. Men hvor meget denne nu end piskede på hestene, var de dog ikke til at få af stedet, og så måtte justitsråden skjönt bede ham om at stå af vognen igjen.
english_publication: Judge Fisher from Vestervig drove one day on the highway and met an old Norwegian there, who went around begging. He stopped and asked him to get up in the wagon, because now he was under arrest for vagrancy. “Oh, no”, says the Norwegian, “let me go, because your honor’s horses can't pull me.” “Well, I don’t think there’ll be any problem with that, just get up in the wagon.” After making a few objections, the Norwegian gets up in the wagon next to the coachman. But however much the coachman whipped the horses, they wouldn’t budge from the spot, and then the judge had to ask him to get down off the wagon again.
